description: The Belgian architect and designer Henry van de Velde was one of the primary exponents of Art Nouveau, an international design style informed by the English Arts and Crafts Movement that flourished at the turn of the 20th century. This samovar, or Russian teakettle, beautifully illustrates the mix of crisp lines and curvilinear motifs that characterizes Van de Velde’s mature Art Nouveau style.
artist_info:
Designed by Henry van de Velde
Belgian
1863-1957
Made by the Workshop of Theodor Müller
Weimar, Germany, founded late 19th century
title: Samovar
